title: Husband annulling wife's vow
vignette: A wife vows to avoid all sweets. Her husband worries she'll become unhappy.

options.text: He annuls the vow on the day he hears it.
He respects her decision and keeps silent.

title: Vowing charity beyond means
vignette: A merchant pledges a large donation if his business succeeds, then earns little.

options.text: Fulfill the vow even if it strains finances.
Give a smaller amount he can manage.

title: Child's vow in parents' home
vignette: A teenager vows to refrain from meat while still dependent on parents for food.

options.text: Parents may override and serve meat.
Honor the child's personal vow.

title: Vow made in anger
vignette: During a heated argument, a man vows never to visit his friend's home again.

options.text: Advise him to seek annulment once calm.
Hold him to the vow despite the anger.

title: Benefit from a forbidden vow
vignette: Two neighbors vow not to enjoy each other's property. Later one needs a tool.

options.text: Permit borrowing in a time of need.
Forbid any use to keep the vow intact.

title: Annulment without a scholar
vignette: No rabbi is available to hear a man's regret about his vow of abstaining from wine.

options.text: Allow three laymen to annul the vow.
Wait for a qualified scholar to return.

title: Conditional vow becomes permanent
vignette: A woman vows to donate if she has a son. Years later she only has daughters.

options.text: Release her from the promise.
Require fulfillment regardless of the condition.

title: Vow to avoid a relative
vignette: A man vows never to speak to his brother after a quarrel.

options.text: Encourage reconciliation and annulment.
He must keep the vow and cut contact.

title: Swearing off communal obligations
vignette: Upset with community politics, a resident vows not to attend community center events.

options.text: Advise him to retract and rejoin activities.
Let him withdraw as he swore.

title: Husband unaware of vow until later
vignette: A wife vowed to avoid wine but didn't tell her husband until weeks later.

options.text: He may annul upon learning even after the day ends.
It's too late; the vow stands.

title: Vowing to study a tractate
vignette: A student vows to finish a lengthy Talmud tractate within a month.

options.text: Encourage steady study even if it takes longer.
Push to fulfill exactly within the month.

title: Vows that harm others
vignette: A shopkeeper vows not to sell goods to a particular customer after a dispute.

options.text: Persuade him to annul the vow and resume trade.
He may keep the vow and refuse service.

title: Public vow for attention
vignette: Someone loudly vows a large donation during prayers to impress others.

options.text: Discourage showy promises; keep it private.
Applaud the generous public commitment.

title: Regretting a lifelong abstention
vignette: An elderly man regrettably remembers a youthful vow never to eat meat again.

options.text: Seek annulment to ease his remaining years.
Maintain the abstention despite regret.

title: Vow made under peer pressure
vignette: Friends pressured a student into vowing daily study hours beyond his ability.

options.text: Release him from the vow to prevent burnout.
He must honor it despite the pressure.
